evidence.title: TypeScript Best Practices 2025: Elevate Your Code Quality
evidence.summary: ### 1.1 **Use Explicit Types**. Let TypeScript infer types when possible, but be explicit when necessary. ### 2.2 **Use Type Aliases for Complex Types**. type ID = number | string; type UserRole = " admin " | " user " | " guest ";. Define your own utility types for specific use cases. ### 5.1 **Use ...

evidence.summary: They allow you to enforce specific patterns and improve type safety for string operations. evidence.title: TypeScript Best Practices in 2025 - DEV Community
evidence.summary: const numberList =[1, 2, 3];// TypeScript infers the type 'number[]'. * **Use `const` for Immutable Values**: For constants, TypeScript can infer their types and narrow down possibilities, leading to more efficient code. const user ={name: ' Mitu ', age: 30};// TypeScript infers the type as { name: ...
